ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned the basics of the Spanish language.
Elementary Spanish: essentially I entered the lass being unable to understand or speak in Spanish and by the end I could maintain limited conversation

I have learned basic Spanish vocabulary along with several different grammar rules and techniques in the Spanish language. I am able to understand elementary Spanish and learn how to communicate simple phrases in a conversation. I learned how to present projects in Spanish as well as write essays in Spanish given a specific prompt. One thing that developed in this course significantly was my Spanish speaking. I was able to practice how to speak Spanish.

I developed a vast knowledge of Spanish since this is only the first course offered for beginners. We began with the alphabet and ended knowing about two tenses as well as the name for various things.
Basic spanish speaking and writing skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Great teacher & student engagement. 
Weaknesses: Timed homework made it diffcult to actively learn from.

The strengths of this course are that it does a good job at explaining the basics (a lot of grammar). The weaknesses of the course are that it can be very difficult to find assignments at times or know if something was assigned without constantly checking the syllabus. It is also difficult to have a project assigned on a Monday and have it due that same week. Sometimes a weekend can be very helpful when completing a big project.
The course is fun, and it has a nice balance between learning the language and learning about Spanish-speaking cultures. However I I feel like more conversation opportunities would improve the course

The strengths of this course would be that the professor is very engaging and encourages every student to speak Spanish whenever given the chance. The professor also allowed room for improvement and gave relevant feedback for the assignments submitted as well as Spanish presentations and oral assignments to help us improve our speaking. A weakness of this course is that the professor spoke and taught in Spanish too often and it was sometimes difficult to understand/learn new topics because I was taught in a language that I'm not that familiar with. An improvement would be to speak more English or a mix of Spanish and English especially when giving instructions.

The course's strengths and weaknesses are the same. In moving very fast, an amazing amount of course material is covered, however this knowledge struggles to cement itself as we practiced each topic for only one day before moving on. If we didn't come back to it later on, the skills from that day would be lost, however words and phrases common to the course were solidified.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would reccomend this course. It provides a great basis of language beginners.
Absolutely, you have got to get started somewhere when learning a language!
Yes, I would recommend this course to another student who is starting a new language. Spanish is very similar to English, and the workload for this course is not that bad.
I would, I think language classes at Yale are meant to help the student quickly become comprehending of a language, and then build upon that knowledge.
